department.dept_long_name: Department of Visual and Environmental Studies

course.title: Adventure and Fantasy Simulation, 1871-2036: Seminar
course.description: Visual constituents of high adventure since the late Victorian era, emphasizing wandering woods, rogues, tomboys, women adventurers, faerie antecedents, halflings, crypto-cartography, Third-Path turning, martial arts, and post-1937 fantasy writing as integrated into contemporary photography, advertising, video, computer-generated simulation, and designed life forms.
course.prerequisites: VES 107, VES 160, and VES 166, or permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Graduate School of Design as 4305.
